venue.name: John F. Kennedy Presidential Library And Museum

item.description:
Ok, baseball isn't that Nerdy (possibly the anti nerd) but baseball lectures at the JFK library I think are sufficiently Nerdy to check out! Here is what the website says:

Celebrating the Centennial of Fenway Park

April 22, 2012 1:00 PM - 2:30 PM

Following a screening of Rooters: The Birth of the Red Sox Nation, Peter Nash, baseball historian and author of Boston's Royal Rooters; Richard Johnson, curator of Boston's Sports Museum; and Thomas Fitzgerald, grandson of Boston mayor "Honey Fitz," discuss the building of the park and its passionate fans, including then-mayor John Francis Fitzgerald. Ken Casey of the Dropkick Murphys closes with a rendition of "Tessie."

 

IMPORTANT NOTE:

Besides just RSVPing on meetupyou also have to register for the event online. Without registering online at the JKF website you can not go to this event. The event is free but you have to register

http://www.jfklibrary.org/Events-and-Awards/Forums.aspx

I'll check back and close this to RSVPs once its sold out at the library.

The library is located next to Umass Boston on Columbia point (a peninsula) just south of downtown. Its a short way from I-93 with signs marking the way. There is free parking onsite but the lot can fill up. You can also get a free shuttle bus there for JFK / Umass station on the Red Line.

 

I would be very happy to take a walk behind the library if anyone is interested in that post event (weather dependent of course). This is the walking path:
item.how_to_find_us: I'll be inside early and attempt to get seats. This will be popular and if you're not early you'll be in the overflow room!
item.name: Celebrating the Centennial of Fenway Park - at JFK Library
